intro: Lithocarpus monticola, commonly known as the mountain stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, characterized by its evergreen broadleaf foliage. It is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in mountainous areas with high humidity. The plant produces hard, woody nuts enclosed in a thick, persistent cupule, a feature typical of the genus Lithocarpus. Its leaves are usually革质 (leathery) and have a deep green color, contributing to its ornamental value. The species is valued for its durable timber and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
